name: Steel Syndicate
ideology: The strong survive. Resources flow to those who can take and hold them. Morality is a luxury. We're honest about what the world is—a market where everything is for sale.
history: Emerged from organized crime, private security, and resource extraction operations that thrived in the chaos. When law collapsed, they filled the vacuum with their own order—brutal, but predictable. Pay up, and they protect. Cross them, and pay differently.
structure: Hierarchical organization built on strength and profit. Bosses control territories, captains run operations, soldiers do the work. Advancement through results. Loyalty rewarded, betrayal punished absolutely.
aesthetic: Hard, utilitarian, intimidating. Black and gunmetal. Visible weapons. Scarred and confident. Everything is armor, even the smiles.

key_events.event: Criminal organizations and private security firms seize resource stockpiles
Syndicate consolidates from rival groups, establishes 'protection' economy
Expansion into raw material extraction creates leverage over Lattice
Some Syndicate elements pushing for legitimacy; others prefer the old ways

archetypes.description: Muscle that backs up Syndicate agreements
archetypes.speech_pattern: Direct, minimal. Presence speaks louder than words. 'You understand.'

archetypes.description: Arranges deals, knows prices and pressure points
archetypes.speech_pattern: Smooth, calculating. 'Let's talk numbers.' Always working an angle.
Authoritative, business-minded. 'This is how it's going to work.'

archetypes.description: Solves problems, makes inconvenient things disappear
archetypes.speech_pattern: Quiet, competent. 'Consider it handled.' Doesn't explain methods.

goals: Control valuable resource extraction and trade routes
Maintain reputation for keeping deals (and punishing breaks)
Expand influence through economic leverage rather than open warfare
Some elements: achieve legitimacy; others: maintain criminal flexibility
methods: Protection arrangements with settlements and operations
Control of raw material supply to create dependencies
Enforcement of contracts through guaranteed consequences
Strategic violence—enough to maintain fear, not enough to unite enemies

current_tensions.about: Past sanctuary violations. Trust is gone. Some want to rebuild it, others don't care.
Syndicate controls materials Lattice needs. Prices keep rising.
Syndicate 'protection' offers feel like threats. Ember remembers who helped and who took.

territory.description: Central Texas corridor from San Antonio to Dallas. Oil infrastructure, weapons manufacturing, raw capitalism.
